cards.name: See the Unwritten
cards.text:
Reveal the top eight cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest into your graveyard.
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, you may put two creature cards onto the battlefield instead of one.

rulings.text: You determine whether the ferocious ability applies before any creature cards are put onto the battlefield. If you put two creature cards onto the battlefield this way, those creatures enter the battlefield at the same time.
Because you're not casting the creature cards, you can't pay any additional or alternative costs. You can't put the cards onto the battlefield face down.
If a card you put onto the battlefield this way has {X} in its mana cost, X is considered to be 0.

Some ferocious abilities that appear on instants and sorceries use the word "instead." These spells have an upgraded effect if you control a creature with power 4 or greater as they resolve. For these, you only get the upgraded effect, not both effects.
Ferocious abilities of instants and sorceries that don't use the word "instead" will provide an additional effect if you control a creature with power 4 or greater as they resolve.

foreignNames.name: Voir ce qui n'est pas écrit
Vedere Ciò che Non è Scritto
書かれざるものの視認

cards.originalText:
Reveal the top eight cards of your library. You may put a creature card from among them onto the battlefield. Put the rest into your graveyard.
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, you may put two creature cards onto the battlefield instead of one.

cards.name: Despise
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature or planeswalker card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"You have returned from fire, traitor. This time I will see you leave as ashes."
—Zurgo, to Sarkhan Vol
cards.originalText: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a creature or planeswalker card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Master the Way
cards.text: Draw a card. Master the Way deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor:
"The Way has no beginning and no end. It is simply the path."
—Narset, khan of the Jeskai

rulings.text: Use the number of cards in your hand after you draw the card to determine how much damage Master the Way deals to the target creature or player. (Remember that Master the Way is not in your hand; it's on the stack.)
If the creature or player is an illegal target as Master the Way tries to resolve, Master the Way will be countered and none of its effects will happen. You won't draw a card.

cards.originalText: Draw a card. Master the Way deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of cards in your hand.

cards.name: Sultai Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target monocolored creature.
• Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
• Draw two cards, then discard a card.
cards.flavor: "Strike," the fumes hiss. "Raise an empire with your ambition."

rulings.text: A monocolored creature is exactly one color. Colorless creatures aren't monocolored.

cards.originalText:
Choose one —
• Destroy target monocolored creature.
• Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
• Draw two cards, then discard a card.

cards.name: Woolly Loxodon
cards.text: Morph {5}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: Even among the hardiest warriors of the Temur, loxodons are respected for their adaptation to the mountain snows.

rulings.text: Morph lets you cast a card face down by paying {3}, and lets you turn the face-down permanent face up any time you have priority by paying its morph cost.

The face-down spell has no mana cost and has a converted mana cost of 0. When you cast a face-down spell, put it on the stack face down so no other player knows what it is, and pay {3}. This is an alternative cost.

When the spell resolves, it enters the battlefield as a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, creature types, or abilities. It's colorless and has a converted mana cost of 0. Other effects that apply to the creature can still grant it any of these characteristics.

Any time you have priority, you may turn the face-down creature face up by revealing what its morph cost is and paying that cost. This is a special action. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to. Only a face-down permanent can be turned face up this way; a face-down spell cannot.
Because the permanent is on the battlefield both before and after it's turned face up, turning a permanent face up doesn't cause any enters-the-battlefield abilities to trigger.

A permanent that turns face up or face down changes characteristics but is otherwise the same permanent. Spells and abilities that were targeting that permanent, as well as Auras and Equipment that were attached to the permanent, aren't affected.
At any time, you can look at a face-down spell or permanent you control. You can't look at face-down spells or permanents you don't control unless an effect instructs you to do so.

You must ensure that your face-down spells and permanents can easily be differentiated from each other. You're not allowed to mix up the cards that represent them on the battlefield in order to confuse other players. The order they entered the battlefield should remain clear. Common methods for doing this include using markers or dice, or simply placing them in order on the battlefield.
If a face-down permanent leaves the battlefield, you must reveal it. You must also reveal all face-down spells and permanents you control if you leave the game or if the game ends.

cards.originalText: Morph {5}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Kheru Dreadmaw
cards.text:
Defender
{1}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: Its hunting instincts have long since rotted away. Its hunger, however, remains.

rulings.text: Use the toughness of the creature as it last existed on the battlefield to determine how much life you gain.

cards.originalText:
Defender
{1}{G}, Sacrifice another creature: You gain life equal to the sacrificed creature's toughness.

cards.name: Bring Low
cards.text: Bring Low deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has a +1/+1 counter on it, Bring Low deals 5 damage to it instead.
cards.flavor:
"People are often humbled by the elements. But the elements, too, can be humbled."
—Surrak, khan of the Temur
cards.originalText: Bring Low deals 3 damage to target creature. If that creature has a +1/+1 counter on it, Bring Low deals 5 damage to it instead.

cards.name: Rush of Battle
cards.text: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. Warrior creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by those Warriors also causes their controller to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: The Mardu charge reflects the dragon's speed—and its hunger.

rulings.text: Warrior creatures you control as Rush of Battle resolves gain lifelink in addition to getting +2/+1.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +2/+1 until end of turn. Warrior creatures you control gain lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by those Warriors also causes their controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Swift Kick
cards.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control.
cards.flavor: Shintan sensed the malice in his opponent, but he did not strike until the orc's muscles tensed in preparation to throw the first punch.

rulings.text: You can't cast Swift Kick unless you target both a creature you control and a creature you don't control.
If either target is an illegal target when Swift Kick tries to resolve, neither creature will deal or be dealt damage.

If just the creature you control is an illegal target when Swift Kick tries to resolve, it won't get +1/+0 until end of turn. If the creature you control is a legal target but the creature you don't control isn't, the creature you control will get +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.originalText: Target creature you control gets +1/+0 until end of turn. It fights target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.flavor: The remains of ancient sky tyrants now feed the war-torn land.

cards.name: Mardu Skullhunter
cards.text:
Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield tapped.
Raid — When Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent discards a card.

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

cards.originalText:
Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield tapped.
Raid — When Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield, if you attacked with a creature this turn, target opponent discards a card.

cards.name: Wind-Scarred Crag
cards.text:
Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield tapped.
When Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText:
Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield tapped.
When Wind-Scarred Crag enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
{T}: Add {R} or {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mardu Banner
cards.text:
{T}: Add {R}, {W}, or {B} to your mana pool.
{R}{W}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Mardu Banner: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: Speed to strike, fury to smash.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add {R}, {W}, or {B} to your mana pool.
{R}{W}{B}, {T}, Sacrifice Mardu Banner: Draw a card.

cards.name: Abzan Guide
cards.text:
Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)
Morph {2}{W}{B}{G} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: "These roads are desolate and changeable. Follow me, or die in the wastes."
